text: Donald Kennedy (August 18, 1931 - April 21, 2020) was an American scientist, public administrator and academic. He served as Commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration (1977–79), President of Stanford University (1980–92), and editor-in-chief of Science (journal) (2000–08). Kennedy resigned as president of Stanford University in 1992 in the wake of a scandal involving expenses charged to the federal government. Kennedy died of COVID-19 in Redwood City, California on April 21, 2020 at the age of 88. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in California Category:Commissioners of the Food and Drug Administration Category:Educators from New York City Category:Journalists from New York City Category:Scientists from New York City
title: Donald Kennedy
